titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4520) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to remove impediments in such Code and make our manufacturing, service, and high-technology businesses and workers more competitive and productive both at home and abroad.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4520) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to remove impediments in such Code and make our manufacturing, service, and high-technology businesses and workers more competitive and productive both at home and abroad.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-549, by Mr. Reynolds.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4520 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 189.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 681.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 193 (Roll no. 256).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 195 (Roll no. 257).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 4520, the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004.
